verses.sanskrit_text: अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवम् रत्वीजम् । होतारं रत्नधातमम् ॥
verses.transliteration: agnim īḷe purohitaṃ yajñasya devam ṛtvījam | hotāraṃ ratnadhātamam ||
verses.translation_english: I praise Agni, the chosen Priest, God, minister of the sacrifice, the Hotar, bestower of treasures.

verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso dviśas tiṣṭhati dhruvam |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, stands firmly with steadfast mind.

verses.sanskrit_text: सहस्रं रश्मिं विधाता यजमानं हृदि ध्रुवम् ।
verses.transliteration: sahasraṃ raśmiṃ vidhātā yajamānaṃ hṛdi dhruvam |
verses.translation_english: The arranger of the thousandfold rays establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.
Agni, the priest of the gods, known to all, who comprehends the entire sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो देवो रत्नधातुर्दिवि पर्वतः सविता ।
verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur divi parvataḥ savitā |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, who is in heaven and on the mountains, shine upon us.
Agni is the priest of the gods, the giver of wealth, and the sustainer of the sacrifice.
Agni, mighty and manifold, serves as the priest of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: agnir hi devānāma ahnoḥ samprajāyata yajamānam |
verses.translation_english: Indeed Agni, of the gods, arises each day for the benefit of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajñasya purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: agnir hotā devasya yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthiram |
verses.translation_english: Agni, the priest of the gods, establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.

verses.sanskrit_text: अग्निः पूर्वेभिरुत चेतसो द्रुहसि वसते हि यज्ञे ।
verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso druḥasi vasate hi yajñe |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, dwells firmly in the mind during the sacrifice.
Agni is the priest of the gods, all-knowing, and comprehends the entire sacrifice.
Agni, the wise priest, is the bestower of treasures in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajñasya purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: agnir hotā devasya yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthiram |
verses.translation_english: Agni, the priest of the gods, establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.
Agni, mighty and manifold, serves as the priest of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso dviśas tiṣṭhati dhruvam |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, stands steadfastly with mind fixed.
Agni is the priest of the gods, the giver of wealth, and the sustainer of the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: agnir hotā devasya yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthiram |
verses.translation_english: Agni, the priest of the gods, establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.

verses.transliteration: viṣṇur akṣaraṃ paramam devatā yajamānaṃ hṛdi |
verses.translation_english: Vishnu, the imperishable, the supreme deity, dwells in the heart of the sacrificer.
Vishnu, with his thousandfold stride, acts as the priest of the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso devatā ratnadhātuḥ |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, is the deity who bestows treasures.

verses.transliteration: viṣṇur agnir mahataḥ sahasraḥ yajamānaṃ purohitam |
verses.translation_english: Vishnu and Agni, mighty and manifold, serve as priests of the sacrificer.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो देवो रत्नधातुर्यजमानं हृदि स्थितः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, dwell firmly in our hearts.
Vishnu is the priest of the sacrificer, giver of treasures of the gods.
Agni is the priest of the gods, knowing the entire universe of sacrifice.
Vishnu, with his thousandfold foot, serves as priest of the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.
Agni is the priest of the gods, bestower of wealth, and sustainer of the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: viṣṇur yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthiraṃ devatā ratnadhātuḥ |
verses.translation_english: Vishnu establishes the sacrificer firmly in the heart, bestower of divine treasures.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तम् अपां वीरं गृणन्तो वयं हः ।
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhantam apāṃ vīraṃ gṛṇanto vayaṃ haḥ |
verses.translation_english: We praise Indra, the mighty, the hero, bestower of waters.
Agni and Indra, mighty and manifold, act as priests of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajñasya purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: indraḥ sarvaṃ vidadhāti dyūtyāma ahnoḥ samprahaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Indra distributes all, radiant in the sky during the day.

verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso devatā ratnadhātuḥ |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, is the deity who bestows treasures.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो देवो रत्नधातुर्यजमानं हृदि स्थितः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, dwell firmly in our hearts.
Indra, mighty with thousandfold radiance, serves as priest of the sacrificer.
Agni is the priest of the gods, knowing the entire universe of sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: indraḥ sarvaṃ vidadhāti dyūtyāma ahnoḥ samprahaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Indra distributes all, radiant in the sky during the day.

verses.translation_english: Agni, the priest of the gods, establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.
Agni is the priest of the gods, bestower of treasures, and sustainer of the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, dwell firmly in our hearts.

verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso devatā ratnadhātuḥ |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, is the deity who bestows treasures.
Indra, mighty with thousandfold radiance, serves as priest of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajñasya purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.
Agni is the priest of the gods, knowing the entire universe of sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: agnir hotā devasya yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthiram |
verses.translation_english: Agni, the priest of the gods, establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.

verses.transliteration: indraḥ sarvaṃ vidadhāti dyūtyāma ahnoḥ samprahaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Indra distributes all, radiant in the sky during the day.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तम् अपां वीरं गृणन्तो वयं हः ।
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhantam apāṃ vīraṃ gṛṇanto vayaṃ haḥ |
verses.translation_english: We praise Indra, the mighty, hero, bestower of the waters.
Indra, mighty with thousandfold radiance, serves as priest of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajñasya purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: indraḥ sarvaṃ vidadhāti dyūtyāma ahnoḥ samprahaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Indra distributes all, radiant in the sky during the day.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो देवो रत्नधातुर्यजमानं हृदि स्थितः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, dwell firmly in our hearts.
Indra, mighty with thousandfold radiance, serves as priest of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: indraḥ sarvaṃ vidadhāti dyūtyāma ahnoḥ samprahaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Indra distributes all, radiant in the sky during the day.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वर्धन्तम् अपां वीरं गृणन्तो वयं हः ।
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhantam apāṃ vīraṃ gṛṇanto vayaṃ haḥ |
verses.translation_english: We praise Indra, the mighty, hero, bestower of the waters.
Agni is the priest of the gods, bestower of treasures, and sustainer of the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो देवो रत्नधातुर्यजमानं हृदि स्थितः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, dwell firmly in our hearts.
Indra, mighty with thousandfold radiance, serves as priest of the sacrificer.

verses.transliteration: agnir hotā devasya yajamānaṃ hṛdi sthiram |
verses.translation_english: Agni, the priest of the gods, establishes the sacrificer firmly in his heart.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajamānaṃ purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: indraḥ sarvaṃ vidadhāti dyūtyāma ahnoḥ samprahaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Indra distributes all, radiant in the sky during the day.

verses.transliteration: agniḥ pūrvebhir uta chetaso devatā ratnadhātuḥ |
verses.translation_english: Agni, attended by the ancient seers, is the deity who bestows treasures.

verses.transliteration: sa no devo ratnadhātur yajñasya purohitaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May that God, bestower of treasures, be our priest in the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वो विश्वतस्परि हवामहे जनेभ्यः । अस्माकमस्तु केवलः ॥
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vo viśvatas pari havāmahe janebhyaḥ | asmākam astu kevalaḥ ||
verses.translation_english: We call upon Indra from all directions among the people; may he be ours alone.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः सुतपाव्ने सुत इन्द्राय मद्यते । शृण्वन्तु विश्वे अमृताः ॥
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sutapāvne suta indrāya madyate | śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtāḥ ||
verses.translation_english: The pressed Soma is purified for Indra; it exhilarates Indra. May all the immortal gods hear.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्राय सोममिन्दवो मन्दन्तु वज्रिणे । शृणोतु नः सुतं हवम् ॥
verses.transliteration: indrāya somam indavo mandantu vajriṇe | śṛṇotu naḥ sutaṃ havam ||
verses.translation_english: Let the Soma drops gladden Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt; may he hear our pressed offering and invocation.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं हि त्वा वृषभं वयं सुतावन्तो हवामहे । स नः पितेव सूनवे ॥
verses.transliteration: indraṃ hi tvā vṛṣabhaṃ vayaṃ sutāvanto havāmahe | sa naḥ piteva sūnave ||
verses.translation_english: For you, O Indra the Bull, we who have pressed Soma call upon you; be to us like a father to his son.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्र विश्वतः पृणस्व परि भूषसि । अस्मभ्यं शत्रुतूर्ये ॥
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra viśvataḥ pṛṇasva pari bhūṣasi | asmabhyaṃ śatrutūrye ||
verses.translation_english: Fill us, O Indra, from every side; adorn and protect us in battles against enemies.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा स्ववाँ अवोभिः शूरो नृभिः । आ नो यातु शतक्रतुः ॥
verses.transliteration: indraḥ sutrāmā svavāṃ avobhiḥ śūro nṛbhiḥ | ā no yātu śatakratuḥ ||
verses.translation_english: May Indra, well-guiding, mighty with his aids, the hero among men, the hundred-powered, come to us.

verses.sanskrit_text: नूनं स इन्द्रः सुहवो य इन्द्रः सोमपीतये । स नः पितेव सूनवे ॥
verses.transliteration: nūnaṃ sa indraḥ su-havo ya indraḥ somapītaye | sa naḥ piteva sūnave ||
verses.translation_english: Now may that Indra, easy to invoke, who drinks the Soma, be to us like a father to his son.

verses.sanskrit_text: य इन्द्रः शूरो महिषो वज्रिणः शतक्रतुः । तं वयं हवामहे ॥
verses.transliteration: ya indraḥ śūro mahiṣo vajriṇaḥ śatakratuḥ | taṃ vayaṃ havāmahe ||
verses.translation_english: That Indra, the hero, the mighty one, wielder of the thunderbolt, of a hundred powers — him we invoke.

verses.sanskrit_text: स घा नो योग आ भुवद् राये च पुरुहूत । अस्मभ्यं शत्रुतूर्ये ॥
verses.transliteration: sa ghā no yoga ā bhuvad rāye ca puruhūta | asmabhyaṃ śatrutūrye ||
verses.translation_english: May he indeed come to us for aid, O much-invoked one, for wealth and for overcoming enemies.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्र विश्वतः पृणस्व परि भूषसि । अस्मभ्यं वाजसातये ॥
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra viśvataḥ pṛṇasva pari bhūṣasi | asmabhyaṃ vājasātaye ||
verses.translation_english: Fill us, O Indra, from every side; protect and adorn us for the gaining of strength and prize.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं हि सत्यो मघवन् दाता वाजस्य गोमतः । अस्मभ्यं धेहि च श्रवः ॥
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi satyo maghavan dātā vājasya gomataḥ | asmabhyaṃ dhehi ca śravaḥ ||
verses.translation_english: For you, O bountiful one, are true — the giver of cattle-rich wealth; grant us glory as well.

verses.sanskrit_text: आ नो यातु शतक्रतुरिन्द्रो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः । स नः पातु दुरितात् ॥
verses.transliteration: ā no yātu śatakratur indro viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ | sa naḥ pātu duritāt ||
verses.translation_english: May Indra, the hundred-powered, come to us with all his aids; may he protect us from harm.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वः सुतपा इमं हवामहे जनानाम् । अस्माकं शूरं वज्रिणम् ॥
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vaḥ sutapā imaṃ havāmahe janānām | asmākaṃ śūraṃ vajriṇam ||
verses.translation_english: We invoke Indra, the Soma-drinker, among the people — our hero, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_text: स घा न इन्द्र मघवन् राये च पुरुहूत । अस्मभ्यं शत्रुतूर्ये ॥
verses.transliteration: sa ghā na indra maghavan rāye ca puruhūta | asmabhyaṃ śatrutūrye ||
verses.translation_english: Come to us, O bountiful Indra, much-invoked, for wealth and for overcoming enemies.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्र विश्वतः पृणस्व परि भूषसि । अस्मभ्यं वाजसातये ॥
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra viśvataḥ pṛṇasva pari bhūṣasi | asmabhyaṃ vājasātaye ||
verses.translation_english: Fill us from every side, O Indra; protect and adorn us for the gaining of strength.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं हि सत्यो मघवन् दाता वाजस्य गोमतः । अस्मभ्यं धेहि च श्रवः ॥
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi satyo maghavan dātā vājasya gomataḥ | asmabhyaṃ dhehi ca śravaḥ ||
verses.translation_english: You indeed, O generous one, are the true giver of cattle-rich wealth; grant us glory.

verses.sanskrit_text: आ नो यातु शतक्रतुरिन्द्रो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः । स नः पातु दुरितात् ॥
verses.transliteration: ā no yātu śatakratur indro viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ | sa naḥ pātu duritāt ||
verses.translation_english: May Indra of a hundred powers come to us with all his aids; may he guard us from harm.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः शूरो महिषो वज्रिणः शतक्रतुः । तं वयं हवामहे ॥
verses.transliteration: indraḥ śūro mahiṣo vajriṇaḥ śatakratuḥ | taṃ vayaṃ havāmahe ||
verses.translation_english: Indra, the hero, the mighty one, the thunderbolt-wielder of hundred powers — him we invoke.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः पितेव सूनवेऽग्ने सुपायनो भव । स नो रक्षातु विश्वतः ॥
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ piteva sūnave 'gne supāyano bhava | sa no rakṣātu viśvataḥ ||
verses.translation_english: Be to us like a father to his son; be gracious and easy of access. May he protect us from every side.

verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhanto apturaḥ kṛṇvānā yajñam uttamam |
verses.translation_english: Exalting Indra, the worshippers perform the supreme sacrifice.

verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pātu śatakratur vajrī viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ |
verses.translation_english: May Indra of a hundred powers, the thunderbolt-wielder, protect us with all his aids.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो वृत्रं जघ्न आहवे शक्रो वज्रेण वीर्यवान् ।
verses.transliteration: yo vṛtraṃ jaghna āhave śakro vajreṇa vīryavān |
verses.translation_english: He who in battle slew Vṛtra, mighty Śakra with his thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो अपो मुमोच दुर्ग्रहाः स न इन्द्रः शिवो भवत् ।
verses.transliteration: yo apo mumoca durgrahāḥ sa na indraḥ śivo bhavat |
verses.translation_english: He who released the captive waters — may that Indra be gracious to us.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्र राये च वाजाय च दिधिषसि ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra rāye ca vājāya ca didhiṣasi |
verses.translation_english: You, O Indra, bestow wealth and strength upon us.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं हि शत्रून् अभिभूः शूर विश्वस्य रक्षकः ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ hi śatrūn abhibhūḥ śūra viśvasya rakṣakaḥ |
verses.translation_english: You indeed overpower enemies, O hero, protector of all.

verses.sanskrit_text: आ नो गहि सुतावतो यज्ञस्य प्राविता भव ।
verses.transliteration: ā no gahi sutāvato yajñasya prāvitā bhava |
verses.translation_english: Come to us, enjoyer of Soma; be the protector of the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः सोमस्य पीतये वर्धते वीर्याय च ।
verses.transliteration: indraḥ somasya pītaye vardhate vīryāya ca |
verses.translation_english: Indra grows in strength for drinking Soma and for heroic power.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः श्रवो दधातु नः प्रजां पुष्टिं च वीरवत् ।
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ śravo dadhātu naḥ prajāṃ puṣṭiṃ ca vīravat |
verses.translation_english: May he grant us fame, offspring, and strong prosperity.

verses.sanskrit_text: यस्य तेजो न मिनाति द्यौरिव स्थिरम् ।
verses.transliteration: yasya tejo na mināti dyaur iva sthiram |
verses.translation_english: Whose splendor does not diminish, firm like the sky.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो दासं वज्रेण हनत् शत्रुं च विश्वरूपम् ।
verses.transliteration: yo dāsaṃ vajreṇa hanat śatruṃ ca viśvarūpam |
verses.translation_english: Who struck down the Dasa and the many-formed foe with his bolt.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्राभि भूषसि विश्वतः परि पातु नः ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indrābhi bhūṣasi viśvataḥ pari pātu naḥ |
verses.translation_english: You adorn and protect us on every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: अस्मभ्यं धेहि गोमतं वाजिनं च धनं बहु ।
verses.transliteration: asmabhyaṃ dhehi gomataṃ vājinaṃ ca dhanaṃ bahu |
verses.translation_english: Grant us cattle-rich, strength-giving abundant wealth.

verses.transliteration: śṛṇu no havyam indra gṛṇataḥ stomam uttamam |
verses.translation_english: Hear our offering, O Indra, and our highest praise.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं नो रक्ष दुरिताद् अघायोः परि पातु नः ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no rakṣa duritād aghāyoḥ pari pātu naḥ |
verses.translation_english: Protect us from evil and guard us from sin.
Indra, rich in gifts, wielder of the bolt, lord of the world.

verses.sanskrit_text: स न इन्द्रः स्वस्तये मघवा नो अवतु ।
verses.transliteration: sa na indraḥ svastaye maghavā no avatu |
verses.translation_english: May Indra, the bountiful, protect us for well-being.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो विश्वानि परि भूषति वीर्याणि च कर्मसु ।
verses.transliteration: yo viśvāni pari bhūṣati vīryāṇi ca karmasu |
verses.translation_english: Who encompasses all powers and heroic deeds.

verses.transliteration: taṃ vayaṃ havāmahe śūraṃ vajriṇam uttamam |
verses.translation_english: We invoke that hero, the supreme thunderbolt-wielder.

verses.sanskrit_text: आ नो यातु पुरुहूतः सोमपाः सुतपावृषा ।
verses.transliteration: ā no yātu puruhūtaḥ somapāḥ sutapāvṛṣā |
verses.translation_english: May the much-invoked Soma-drinker come to us.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः पातु विश्वतः स नो अवतु सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: indraḥ pātu viśvataḥ sa no avatu sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May Indra guard us from every side; may he protect us everywhere.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो जात एव प्रथमः मनस्वान् देवो देवान् क्रतुना पर्यभूषत् ।
verses.transliteration: yo jāta eva prathamo manasvān devo devān kratunā paryabhūṣat |
verses.translation_english: He who, born first and mighty in mind, by his power surpassed the gods.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो पृथिवीं व्यथमानामदृंहद् यो पर्वतान् प्रकुपिताँ अरम्णात् ।
verses.transliteration: yo pṛthivīṃ vyathamānām adṛṃhad yo parvatān prakupitāṃ aramṇāt |
verses.translation_english: He who made firm the trembling earth and calmed the shaking mountains.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो अन्तरिक्षं विममे वरीयो यो द्यामस्तभ्नात् स जनास इन्द्रः ।
verses.transliteration: yo antarikṣaṃ vimame varīyo yo dyām astabhnāt sa janāsa indraḥ |
verses.translation_english: He who measured out the mid-space and propped up the heaven — he, O people, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो हत्वा अहिं अरिणात् सप्त सिन्धून् यो गा उदाजदपधा वलस्य ।
verses.transliteration: yo hatvā ahiṃ ariṇāt sapta sindhūn yo gā udājad apadhā valasya |
verses.translation_english: He who slew the serpent and released the seven rivers, who drove out the cows from Vala’s cave.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो अश्मनो अन्तरग्निं जजान संवृक् समत्सु जनयन् वीर्यम् ।
verses.transliteration: yo aśmano antar agniṃ jajāna saṃvṛk samatsu janayan vīryam |
verses.translation_english: He who generated fire from the stone and created strength in battles.

verses.sanskrit_text: यस्याश्वासः प्रदिशि यस्य गावो यस्य ग्रामाः यस्य विश्वे रथासः ।
verses.transliteration: yasyāśvāsaḥ pradiśi yasya gāvo yasya grāmā yasya viśve rathāsaḥ |
verses.translation_english: Whose are the horses in all directions, whose the cattle, whose the villages and all the chariots.

verses.sanskrit_text: यः सूर्यं य उषसं जजान यो अपां नेता स जनास इन्द्रः ।
verses.transliteration: yaḥ sūryaṃ ya uṣasaṃ jajāna yo apāṃ netā sa janāsa indraḥ |
verses.translation_english: He who produced the Sun and the Dawn, who is the leader of the waters — he, O people, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_text: यं स्मा पृच्छन्ति कुह सेति घोरम् ।
verses.transliteration: yaṃ smā pṛcchanti kuha seti ghoram |
verses.translation_english: Him whom they ask about — where is he? — the terrible one.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो अर्णवं महिना पर्यतिष्ठद् यो द्यामरक्षद् य उषासमावः ।
verses.transliteration: yo arṇavaṃ mahinā paryatiṣṭhad yo dyām arakṣad ya uṣāsam āvaḥ |
verses.translation_english: He who by greatness encompassed the flood, who guarded the heaven and sustained the dawn.
He who overpowers enemies on every side.
Who drinks the Soma in exhilaration like a bull.
Who generated prayer and the sacrifice.
Who is the source of all, like a father.
Who struck down the impious Dasyus.
He, O people, is Indra.
Exalting Indra, the Soma-drinker, he becomes victorious.

verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pātu śatakratur vajrī viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ |
verses.translation_english: May Indra of a hundred powers, wielder of the bolt, protect us with all his aids.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो वृत्रं जघ्न वज्रेण वीर्यवान् प्रचुरः ।
verses.transliteration: yo vṛtraṃ jaghna vajreṇa vīryavān prachuraḥ |
verses.translation_english: He who slew Vṛtra with his mighty bolt, abundant in strength.
He who released the waters, for the enjoyment of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्र विश्वतः पृणस्व परि भूषसि ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra viśvataḥ pṛṇasva pari bhūṣasi |
verses.translation_english: You, O Indra, fill us from all sides and adorn us.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः रक्षतु शत्रून् विश्वतः परि ।
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ rakṣatu śatrūn viśvataḥ pari |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from enemies on every side.
Indra, the hero, wielder of the thunderbolt, mighty with thousandfold power.

verses.sanskrit_text: आ नो यातु सुतपा यज्ञस्य रक्षकः ।
verses.transliteration: ā no yātu sutapā yajñasya rakṣakaḥ |
verses.translation_english: May the much-invoked Soma-drinker come to us, protector of the sacrifice.
May he come to us with offerings, for Soma-drinking and prosperity.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो विश्वानि परि भूषति वीर्याणि च कर्मसु ।
verses.transliteration: yo viśvāni pari bhūṣati vīryāṇi ca karmasu |

verses.transliteration: taṃ vayaṃ havāmahe śūraṃ vajriṇam uttamam |
verses.translation_english: We invoke that hero, the supreme thunderbolt-wielder.

verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra viśvataḥ pṛṇasva pari bhūṣasi |
verses.translation_english: You, O Indra, fill us from all sides and adorn us.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः रक्षतु शत्रून् विश्वतः परि ।
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ rakṣatu śatrūn viśvataḥ pari |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from enemies on every side.
Indra, the hero, wielder of the thunderbolt, mighty with thousandfold power.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः पातु विश्वतः स नो अवतु सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: indraḥ pātu viśvataḥ sa no avatu sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May Indra guard us from every side; may he protect us everywhere.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रं वयं महाधनं हवामहे वज्रिणं शूरमुत्तमम् ।
verses.transliteration: indraṃ vayaṃ mahādhanaṃ havāmahe vajriṇaṃ śūram uttamam |
verses.translation_english: We invoke Indra, the great bestower of wealth, the heroic wielder of the thunderbolt.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो विश्वानि वार्या कृणोतु विश्वतः परि ।
verses.transliteration: sa no viśvāni vāryā kṛṇotu viśvataḥ pari |
verses.translation_english: May he grant us all desirable blessings from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो वृत्रं जघ्न वज्रेण सुतस्य पीतये ।
verses.transliteration: yo vṛtraṃ jaghna vajreṇa sutasya pītaye |
verses.translation_english: He who slew Vṛtra with the thunderbolt for the drinking of Soma.
He who is the creator of the waters, the universal worker.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्र अभि रक्ष विश्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indra abhi rakṣa viśvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: Protect us, O Indra, on all sides.
With you, O hero, may we overcome our foes.

verses.sanskrit_text: इन्द्रः पातु नो विश्वतः स नो अवतु सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: indraḥ pātu no viśvataḥ sa no avatu sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May Indra guard us from every side; may he protect us everywhere.

verses.sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मणस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हाद् द्युमद्विभाति क्रतुमज्जनेषु ।
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇaspate ati yad aryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumaj janeṣu |
verses.translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, when you surpass the hostile, you shine gloriously among people with wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो नः शंसं मनुते दुरेवो निहन्ति शत्रून् ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ।
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ śaṃsaṃ manute durevo nihanti śatrūn brahmaṇaspatiḥ |
verses.translation_english: Brahmanaspati destroys the enemies who intend harm against us.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो विश्वानि वार्या कृणोतु वाजं दधातु नः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no viśvāni vāryā kṛṇotu vājaṃ dadhātu naḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he grant us all desirable blessings and bestow strength upon us.

verses.sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मणस्पते सुश्रवसं कृतं नो विश्वदेव्या अदि शृणोतु ।
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇaspate suśravasaṃ kṛtaṃ no viśvadevyā adi śṛṇotu |
verses.translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, may our praise be heard among all the gods.

verses.transliteration: yo gotrā bhidad valam ardayat saḥ |
verses.translation_english: He who broke open the enclosures and crushed Vala.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो रक्षतु विश्वतः पातु नः सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no rakṣatu viśvataḥ pātu naḥ sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: बृहस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हात् प्र ब्रह्माणो जनयन्त देवाः ।
verses.transliteration: bṛhaspate ati yad aryo arhāt pra brahmāṇo janayanta devāḥ |
verses.translation_english: O Bṛhaspati, when you overcome the foe, the sacred words are generated by the gods.

verses.sanskrit_text: स त्वं न इन्द्रवद् रक्ष ब्रह्मणस्पते ।
verses.transliteration: sa tvaṃ na indravad rakṣa brahmaṇaspate |
verses.translation_english: Protect us like Indra, O Brahmanaspati.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो नः पाति स जनिता स नः शूरः ।
verses.transliteration: yo naḥ pāti sa janitā sa naḥ śūraḥ |
verses.translation_english: He who protects us is our creator and hero.
O Brahmanaspati, make our ritual easy and successful.
May he protect us with blessings and strength.
O Brahmanaspati, guard us in all things.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो देवेषु प्रथमः स नः पातु ।
verses.transliteration: yo deveṣu prathamaḥ sa naḥ pātu |
verses.translation_english: He who is foremost among the gods, may he protect us.
May Brahmanaspati destroy our enemies.
Protect us, O Brahmanaspati, from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः पातु दुरिताद् अभि नः पातु सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pātu duritād abhi naḥ pātu sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from evil and guard us everywhere.
Grant us good renown, O Brahmanaspati.
You opened the path for our cows.
May Brahmanaspati protect us from every direction.

verses.sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मणस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हात् प्र देवत्रा ब्रह्मणो देवयन्तः ।
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇaspate ati yad aryo arhāt pra devatrā brahmaṇo devayantaḥ |
verses.translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, when you overcome the foe, the worshippers advance their sacred prayer to the gods.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं नो गा अवृणोः पथि विश्वान्यर्यो दुरितानि परि ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ no gā avṛṇoḥ pathi viśvāny aryo duritāni pari |
verses.translation_english: You have opened the path for our cows and removed all evils, O noble one.

verses.transliteration: yo gotrā bhidad valam ardayad brahmaṇaspatiḥ |
verses.translation_english: Brahmanaspati who broke the enclosures and crushed Vala.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो रक्षतु विश्वतः स नः पातु सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no rakṣatu viśvataḥ sa naḥ pātu sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मणस्पते सुगं नो अध्वरं कृधि वाजं नः कृणुहि ।
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇaspate sugaṃ no adhvaraṃ kṛdhi vājaṃ naḥ kṛṇuhi |
verses.translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, make our sacrifice easy and grant us strength.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं न इन्द्रवद् अभि रक्ष ब्रह्मणस्पते ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ na indravad abhi rakṣa brahmaṇaspate |
verses.translation_english: Protect us like Indra, O Brahmanaspati.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो देवेषु प्रथमः स नः शूरः पातु ।
verses.transliteration: yo deveṣu prathamaḥ sa naḥ śūraḥ pātu |
verses.translation_english: He who is foremost among the gods, may that hero protect us.
May he guard us with blessings and strength.
O Brahmanaspati, protect us in all things.
May Brahmanaspati destroy our enemies.

verses.sanskrit_text: अव त्वं नो ब्रह्मणस्पते विश्वतः पातु ।
verses.transliteration: ava tvaṃ no brahmaṇaspate viśvataḥ pātu |
verses.translation_english: Protect us, O Brahmanaspati, from every direction.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः पातु दुरिताद् अभि नः पातु सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ pātu duritād abhi naḥ pātu sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from evil and guard us everywhere.
Grant us good renown, O Brahmanaspati.
May Brahmanaspati protect us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मणस्पते सुगं नो अध्वरं कृधि देवेषु यज्ञियम् ।
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇaspate sugaṃ no adhvaraṃ kṛdhi deveṣu yajñiyam |
verses.translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, make our sacrifice easy and worthy among the gods.

verses.sanskrit_text: त्वं नः पातु विश्वतः शूरो ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ।
verses.transliteration: tvaṃ naḥ pātu viśvataḥ śūro brahmaṇaspatiḥ |
verses.translation_english: May the heroic Brahmanaspati protect us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: यो गोत्रा भिदद् वलमर्दयत् स नः पातु ।
verses.transliteration: yo gotrā bhidad valam ardayat sa naḥ pātu |
verses.translation_english: He who broke open the enclosures and crushed Vala—may he protect us.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो विश्वानि वार्या दधातु ब्रह्मणस्पतिः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no viśvāni vāryā dadhātu brahmaṇaspatiḥ |
verses.translation_english: May Brahmanaspati grant us all desirable treasures.
May Brahmanaspati protect us from every direction.

verses.sanskrit_text: ब्रह्मणस्पते अति यदर्यो अर्हाद् द्युमद्विभाति क्रतुमज्जनेषु ।
verses.transliteration: brahmaṇaspate ati yad aryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumaj janeṣu |
verses.translation_english: O Brahmanaspati, when you overcome the foe, you shine gloriously among people with wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नो विश्वानि वार्या कृणोतु वाजं दधातु नः ।
verses.transliteration: sa no viśvāni vāryā kṛṇotu vājaṃ dadhātu naḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he grant us all desirable treasures and bestow strength upon us.

verses.transliteration: yo gotrā bhidad valam ardayad brahmaṇaspatiḥ |
verses.translation_english: Brahmanaspati who broke open the enclosures and crushed Vala.

verses.sanskrit_text: स नः रक्षतु विश्वतः पातु नः सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: sa naḥ rakṣatu viśvataḥ pātu naḥ sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: May he protect us from every side.
May Brahmanaspati guard us from every direction.

verses.sanskrit_text: मित्रं हुवे पूतदक्षं वरुणं च ऋशादसम् ।
verses.transliteration: mitraṃ huve pūtadakṣaṃ varuṇaṃ ca ṛśādasam |
verses.translation_english: I invoke Mitra of pure skill and Varuna, the destroyer of foes.

verses.transliteration: āryamaṇaṃ bhagaṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ dakṣam aṃśam |
verses.translation_english: Aryaman, Bhaga, Mitra, Varuna, Daksha and Amsa.
May the Adityas and Aditi protect us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: ते नः शं यो रराणा विश्वानि वार्या ।
verses.transliteration: te naḥ śaṃ yo rarāṇā viśvāni vāryā |
verses.translation_english: May they grant us peace and all desirable blessings.
May Varuna, Mitra, and Aryaman protect us.
May Bhaga grant us wealth from every direction.
May Aryaman guard us with gracious protection.

verses.sanskrit_text: मित्रो नः शं यच्छतु वरुणो नः शं यच्छतु ।
verses.transliteration: mitro naḥ śaṃ yacchatu varuṇo naḥ śaṃ yacchatu |
verses.translation_english: May Mitra grant us peace; may Varuna grant us peace.

verses.sanskrit_text: ते नो विश्वानि दुरितानि परि दधतु ।
verses.transliteration: te no viśvāni duritāni pari dadhatu |
verses.translation_english: May they remove all evils from us.
May the Adityas guard us on every side.
May Aditi protect us from every direction.
O Mitra and Varuna, protect us with gracious shelter.
We invoke Aryaman, Bhaga, and Daksha.
May Varuna guard us on the path.
May Mitra protect us from every side.
May Bhaga grant us prosperity.
May Aryaman protect us.
May the Adityas protect us from all sides.
Hear this invocation, O Varuna.

verses.transliteration: kim agna idaṃ varuṇa tvā cikīrṣe |
verses.translation_english: What offense have I committed, O Varuna?

verses.sanskrit_text: यच्चिद्धि ते विशो यथा प्र देवा ।
verses.transliteration: yac cid dhi te viśo yathā pra devā |
verses.translation_english: If we, O god, have transgressed your laws among men.

verses.sanskrit_text: अव त्वं नः वरुण विश्वतो रक्ष ।
verses.transliteration: ava tvaṃ naḥ varuṇa viśvato rakṣa |
verses.translation_english: Protect us, O Varuna, from every side.
Do not bind us with your snares, O Varuna.

verses.sanskrit_text: उत नो विश्वानि दुरितानि परि मृक्षीः ।
verses.transliteration: uta no viśvāni duritāni pari mṛkṣīḥ |
verses.translation_english: Remove from us all sins and evils.
Loosen your bonds and release us.

verses.sanskrit_text: यच्चिद्धि ते विश्वो यथा प्र देवा ।
verses.transliteration: yac cid dhi te viśvo yathā pra devā |
verses.translation_english: If we have sinned knowingly or unknowingly.
Forgive our offenses and be gracious to us.
May Varuna protect us from every direction.

verses.sanskrit_text: अव त्वं नो वरुण सर्वतः पातु ।
verses.transliteration: ava tvaṃ no varuṇa sarvataḥ pātu |
verses.translation_english: Guard us, O Varuna, on every side.
I invoke the worshipful gods, the Viśvadevas.
May they grant us all desirable blessings.
May the gods come to us with gracious protection.
May all the gods protect us from every side.
May they remove all evils from us.
O all gods, protect us with gracious shelter.
May all the gods strengthen us with the offering.
May they grant us all desirable blessings.
May the gods come to us with gracious protection.
May all the gods guard us on every side.
May they wipe away our sins and evils.
May the gods bestow heroic strength upon us.

verses.sanskrit_text: विश्वे देवाः सुशर्मणा पात नः सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: viśve devāḥ suśarmaṇā pāta naḥ sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: O all gods, protect us from every direction with gracious shelter.
O all gods, hear my invocation.
May they grant us all desirable blessings.
May the gods come to us with gracious protection.
May all the gods guard us from every direction.
May all the gods bestow heroic strength upon us.

verses.sanskrit_text: राकामहं सुहवां हुवे शृणोतु नः सुभगा बोधतु त्वम् ।
verses.transliteration: rākām ahaṃ suhavāṃ huve śṛṇotu naḥ subhagā bodhatu tvam |
verses.translation_english: I invoke Rākā, easy to call; may the fortunate goddess hear us and awaken.
I invoke Sinīvālī, gracious and easy to call.

verses.sanskrit_text: या गर्भं धेहि सुशेवं बहुधा पुत्रवन्तम् ।
verses.transliteration: yā garbhaṃ dhehi suśevaṃ bahudhā putravantam |
verses.translation_english: May she grant a good and prosperous offspring.
May the goddesses be gracious and fortunate to us.
May Rākā bestow wealth upon us.
May Sinīvālī grant us many children.
May the two goddesses protect us from every side.
May gracious Rākā and Sinīvālī protect us.

verses.sanskrit_text: शृणोतु नः शृणवाम सोमं रुद्राय हव्यम् ।
verses.transliteration: śṛṇotu naḥ śṛṇavāma somaṃ rudrāya havyam |
verses.translation_english: May Rudra hear us as we offer Soma and oblation to him.
Salutations to you, O blessed Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_text: मृड नो रुद्र उत नो मयस्कृधि ।
verses.transliteration: mṛḍa no rudra uta no mayaskṛdhi |
verses.translation_english: Be gracious to us, O Rudra, and grant us happiness.
Harm not our children or descendants; be kind to them.
For you, O Rudra, are auspicious and benevolent.

verses.sanskrit_text: अव रुद्र पाशान् मुमुचो नः सर्वतः ।
verses.transliteration: ava rudra pāśān mumucō naḥ sarvataḥ |
verses.translation_english: Release us from bonds, O Rudra, and protect us from every side.

verses.sanskrit_text: आ वो राजानो मरुतो गृणाना हवामहे ।
verses.transliteration: ā vo rājāno maruto gṛṇānā havāmahe |
verses.translation_english: We invoke you, O royal Maruts, with praise.
For you, O Maruts, are indeed heroes.
With oblation we magnify you, O Maruts.
May they protect us from every side.
The Maruts are the hosts of Rudra.
May they come to us with gracious protection.
May they grant us wealth.
May they bestow heroic strength upon us.
May the Maruts guard us from every direction.
They are the heroic sons of Rudra.
We invoke you, O Maruts.
May the Maruts protect us from every side.
We choose Apām Napāt, the seer, the bestower of treasures.
Who shines like fire with radiant flames.
Who is the king of the rivers.
Golden in form, resplendent in beauty.
May he bestow treasures upon us.
We invoke Apām Napāt.
Who is pure and purifying.
Who sustains all the worlds.
May he protect us from every side.
We seek the best bestower of riches.
Apām Napāt, the gracious one.
Who is the friend of the gods.
Bring us wealth through him.
With offerings we bow in reverence.
We praise Apām Napāt.

verses.transliteration: indraṃ vardhanto apturaḥ kṛṇvānā yajñam uttamam |
verses.translation_english: Exalting Indra, the active ones perform the excellent sacrifice.
May that great one protect us.
Indra comes to drink the Soma.
You are the wielder of the thunderbolt, the slayer of Vṛtra.
May he bestow wealth upon us.
Salutations to Indra.
With oblation we invoke Indra and Bṛhaspati.
For you two are bestowers of wealth.
Indra with strength, Bṛhaspati with sacred chants.
May you both protect us from every side.
Salutations to Indra and Bṛhaspati.
With oblation we invoke Savitṛ.
He who sustains the universe with brilliance.
May he protect us from every direction.
May Savitṛ grant us wealth.
Salutations to Savitṛ.
May all the gods hear our invocation.
May they grant us all desirable blessings.
May the gods come to us with gracious protection.
May all the gods guard us from every direction.
May they remove all evils from us.
O all gods, protect us with gracious shelter.
With oblation we invoke Indra and Agni.
May they protect us from every side.
May mighty Indra guard us.
May Agni, with oblation, increase our wealth.
May Mitra and Varuna protect us.
May Indra and Rudra increase our wealth.
May Agni and Indra protect us from every side.
May they bestow wealth upon us from all directions.
May Indra, Agni, Mitra, and Varuna guard us.
May they protect us from every direction.
With oblation we invoke all the gods.
May they grant us all desirable blessings.
May the gods come to us with gracious protection.
May all the gods guard us from every side.
May they remove all evils from us.
O all gods, protect us with gracious shelter.
With oblation we invoke Agni.
May he protect us from every side.
Agni, mighty and all-powerful.
May he bestow wealth upon us.
With oblation, we magnify him.
May he bestow upon us precious treasures.
May Agni protect us from every direction.
May he grant us wealth from all directions.
With offerings we bow in reverence.
We invoke Agni with oblation.
With oblation we invoke Indra with gracious protection.
May mighty Indra protect us from every direction.
May he bestow wealth upon us from all sides.
We invoke Indra, full of heroic strength.
May Mitra and Varuna protect us.
May Indra guard us from every side.
Salutations to Indra.
